body_markdown:
# Community Launches 🚀

- **[Q1 Roadmap Loop](https://stackoverflow.blog/2021/01/28/the-loop-community-public-platform-roadmap-q1-2021/)** The community and public platform team shared their strategy and roadmap for Q1 2021

- \*\*[Stack Gives Back 2020 ](https://stackoverflow.blog/2021/02/04/stack-gives-back-2020/)\*\*Every year Stack has a program where we donate $100 per moderator towards a charity. Check out our blog post to see how we did this year!

- **SLA for Curator Support Team** The team will be focusing on triaged tickets coming into our queue. We’ll get a baseline for how many we can handle and what the flow typically looks like.

- **Moderator D&I training distribution** We’ve made our D&I training available to all moderators who wish to take it!

- **Response feature for tickets** We’ve built automations so that users will always hear back from us when using the contact form. Users had requested that we get back to them once we close investigations on their reports, and now we’ll be able to for everyone!

- \*\*[Moderator Facetime ](https://stackoverflow.com/c/moderators/questions/3604)\*\*This is now the Quarterly Mod/CM Meetup. We’ll hold one per quarter alternating between video and async text interactions.

- \*\*[10 Year Celebration for Stack Exchange communities ](https://stackoverflow.com/c/moderators/questions/3644)\*\*Network sites that turn 10 each quarter will have the opportunity to be featured in a quarterly blog to include highlights and user stories. It’s our way of celebrating with them on this momentous occasion.

- \*\*[Moderator Satisfaction Survey Q1, 2021 ](https://stackoverflow.com/c/moderators/q/3647/369)\*\*We want to continue to track our Moderator sentiment by surveying them every quarter. Reports are shared with the mods and with the company.

- \*\*[Moku Moku Kai on Stack Overflow in Japanese ](https://ja.meta.stackoverflow.com/q/3497/78)\*\*A soon-to-be tradition where SOja users are invited to join a two-day event where they vote and answer questions together. They share conversations in a chatroom and then final stats are put together for them to see.

# Community In Progress

- **Moderator Council** This quarter we finalized and shared our MNDA with the council and the mod teams. We have also begun the nomination process for elections.

- **Swag Distribution-** We’ve organized each of the swag packages to be sent out and we’re in the process of finalizing the email that users will get when they are able to receive swag. We’re looking to start sending these emails by the first week of April.
title: Community Announcements & Updates - Q1 2021

  • **Moderator Facetime **This is now the Quarterly Mod/CM Meetup. We’ll hold one per quarter alternating between video and async text interactions.

  • **10 Year Celebration for Stack Exchange communities **Network sites that turn 10 each quarter will have the opportunity to be featured in a quarterly blog to include highlights and user stories. It’s our way of celebrating with them on this momentous occasion.

  • **Moderator Satisfaction Survey Q1, 2021 **We want to continue to track our Moderator sentiment by surveying them every quarter. Reports are shared with the mods and with the company.

  • **Moku Moku Kai on Stack Overflow in Japanese **A soon-to-be tradition where SOja users are invited to join a two-day event where they vote and answer questions together. They share conversations in a chatroom and then final stats are put together for them to see.

Community In Progress

  • Swag Distribution- We’ve organized each of the swag packages to be sent out and we’re in the process of finalizing the email that users will get when they are able to receive swag. We’re looking to start sending these emails by the first week of April.

body_markdown:
# **Overview**

This feature is available starting with the [2019.1 release of Stack Overflow Enterprise](https://support.stackenterprise.co/support/solutions/articles/22000238270-2019-1-1-31-2019/).

As you continue to build your community, you’ll need to be able to quickly assess the health and success of your Stack Overflow Enterprise instance. Your improved Enterprise Dashboard will be your go to tool for viewing all of the most important metrics that can be used to gain insight into a number of areas, or answer questions such as:

* The overall health and activity of your community

* Who the top contributors inside your organization are

* How much time your engineers are saving when looking for answers or technical information

* How successful are your internal marketing strategies at driving engagement

## **Preparing for use**

**Before using the Dashboard for the first time**, your site's historical data needs to be loaded by going to */developer/enterprise/backfill-daily-metrics* . This process can take up to 30 minutes, depending on how much information it will need to pull in. There's a good chance site performance could be impacted due to load on the database, so it's recommended to **run the backfill route during low-activity hours**, keeping the number of affected users to a minimum. Once the data is loaded the dashboard will be ready to use and performance will be back to normal.

**If the [Teams](https://support.stackenterprise.co/support/solutions/articles/22000227004) feature is enabled on your site**: \
As of the [2019.3 release](https://support.stackenterprise.co/support/solutions/articles/22000245194), each Team now has its own activity dashboard, available only to Team owners, like the one introduced for the general area in [2019.2](https://support.stackenterprise.co/support/solutions/articles/22000241709). It looks and feels the same but is now specific to that Team. Similar to the general area, the Site Administrators need to access */developer/enterprise/backfill-daily-metrics/all-teams once*, in order to populate the Teams dashboard with the initial dataset.

## **Key Features**

Your Enterprise Dashboard provides all historical data from your community across a variety of metrics. You can filter the data by the following time frames:

* Last Week

* Last 4 Weeks

* Last 3 Months

* Last 6 Months

* Last 12 Months

* All Time

* Custom Range

The data on your dashboard **refreshes daily at Midnight UTC.** In addition to metrics, you’ll also find trend data plotted in graphs, percent change for every data point, as well as benchmarks for your Interaction Rate and Answer Ratio. If you would like to see the raw data broken down by day, you can export it at any time by downloading it in .csv format.

## **Site Metrics and Definitions**

Your Enterprise Dashboard contains a lot of metrics to help you assess the health of your community and better understand how your developers are engaging with one another in your instance. Below is a list of the metrics as well as a brief description of their measured value:

* **Interaction Rate:** Average number of answers, votes, and comments, per question on the site.

* **New Questions:** Total number of new questions posted in the selected time period, including all questions, whether deleted, closed, duplicated, etc. Excludes edits.

* **New Answers:** Total number of new answers posted in the selected time period, excluding edits.

* **Median time to answer:** Time from when a question was initially posted to the time the first answer was posted.

  * *Note: This only looks at answered questions. For further reading on this calculation, please see our article on [Median Time to Answer](https://support.stackenterprise.co/support/solutions/articles/22000225055-sql-query-median-time-to-answer-over-a-single-time-period-).*

* **Answer Ratio:** Total number of questions that have accepted answers, non-accepted answers, and no answers.

* **Daily Unique Visitors:** Highest number of unique daily visitors to your site in the specified time frame

* **Votes:** Total number of votes (both upvotes and downvotes).

* **Searches:** Total number of searches performed.

* **Comments:** Total number of new comments posted in the selected time period, including deleted comments. Excludes edits.

* **Edits:** Total number of edits on questions and answers. Excludes comment edits.

* **Flags:** Total number of flags raised.

* **User Participation:** Highest number of active and passive users in the specified time frame

  * *Active Users:* Users who’ve asked or answered a question; commented, reviewed, or voted on a post; or flagged a post.

  * *Passive Users:* Users who only visited or searched.

## **Interpreting your Data**

Because every community is different, it’s best to look at the trends within your community as opposed to comparing metrics to others. **It’s important to note that you will see fluctuations in these as your community grows and matures. This is perfectly normal!** It’s only when there are significant changes or consistent trends should you look to take action.

Here are a few guidelines to help you get started reviewing the health of your community. *As always, you can contact your Community Development Manager to discuss these in more detail as well as ways to improve.*

The first metric you’ll want to look at is your **Interaction Rate**. By measuring the average number of answers, votes, and comments, per question, you can see how much value your users are getting from the community. A rate above 5 shows that your users are not only engaging with their peers on the platform but also putting in their own time and effort to post content.

Your **New Questions** and **New Answers** are two more indicators of engagement and activity within your community. Community size and maturity can have a big impact on these metrics, so it’s more important to look at them over time to ensure neither are dropping too much. It’s also worth looking at these when new groups of users are introduced to the site or after awareness/engagement projects kick off internally. Any spikes in activity can indicate new groups are using Stack Overflow Enterprise and finding value in your community or that your marketing efforts were successful.

The **Median Time to Answer** is another important metric, as it measures how quickly your users are getting answers to their questions and can be a great indicator for ROI. The shorter the time, the more efficient your users can work and the more money you can save in lost productivity. This should decrease as your community matures and adds in more integrations/webhooks.

Your **Answer Ratio** will be more important as your community matures and should be used to identify potential knowledge gaps and/or engagement issues. If you see a large amount of unanswered questions in general or for a specific tag, this could indicate the need for more experts/users watching those tags or a need to set up more webhooks and/or integrations. You’ll also want to look at your accepted answers rate, which should be above 40% to ensure users can always find the correct/most helpful answers.

The **Daily Unique Visitors** metric simply tracks the number of users logging in and viewing  the site once per day. An upward trend or positive spikes would indicate more users are making Stack Overflow Enterprise a part of their daily workflow while a significant drop in visits may be attributed to a slower pace of new posts or users gravitating towards other platforms/old habits.

**Votes, Comments, and Edits** are also metrics that track engagement, and positive trends in these show that your users are taking ownership of the community and putting in extra time on the site to improve its overall health. Similar to your visits, negative trends here could mean there’s less new content to interact with on the site.

The number of **Searches** is another great way to measure ROI. More searches on the site show that your users see Stack Overflow Enterprise as the source of truth within your organization. Comparing it to usage across other tools can help you visualize a users workflow as well as potentially identify older tools that are no longer needed.

Your **Flags** metric might change over time, increasing as new users are introduced to the community and then decreasing as they learn how to properly post on the platform. A consistent upward trend in flags should be investigated by your moderators to see if there are repeat offenders or common mistakes that should be addressed with further guidance from your Community Team.

Lastly, the **User Participation** metrics can help you identify your top contributors, emerging mentors, and internal experts. You can also look at these when running contests such as Hackathons or Answerathons to choose winners based on participation.

Your Enterprise Dashboard contains a lot of metrics to help you assess the health of your community and better understand how your developers are engaging with one another in your instance. Below is a list of the metrics as well as a brief description of their measured value:

  • Interaction Rate: Average number of answers, votes, and comments, per question on the site.

  • New Questions: Total number of new questions posted in the selected time period, including all questions, whether deleted, closed, duplicated, etc. Excludes edits.

  • New Answers: Total number of new answers posted in the selected time period, excluding edits.

  • Median time to answer: Time from when a question was initially posted to the time the first answer was posted.

    • Note: This only looks at answered questions. For further reading on this calculation, please see our article on Median Time to Answer.

  • Answer Ratio: Total number of questions that have accepted answers, non-accepted answers, and no answers.

  • Daily Unique Visitors: Highest number of unique daily visitors to your site in the specified time frame

  • Votes: Total number of votes (both upvotes and downvotes).

  • Searches: Total number of searches performed.

  • Comments: Total number of new comments posted in the selected time period, including deleted comments. Excludes edits.

  • Edits: Total number of edits on questions and answers. Excludes comment edits.

  • Flags: Total number of flags raised.

  • User Participation: Highest number of active and passive users in the specified time frame

    • Active Users: Users who’ve asked or answered a question; commented, reviewed, or voted on a post; or flagged a post.

    • Passive Users: Users who only visited or searched.

Interpreting your Data

Because every community is different, it’s best to look at the trends within your community as opposed to comparing metrics to others. It’s important to note that you will see fluctuations in these as your community grows and matures. This is perfectly normal! It’s only when there are significant changes or consistent trends should you look to take action.

Here are a few guidelines to help you get started reviewing the health of your community. As always, you can contact your Community Development Manager to discuss these in more detail as well as ways to improve.

The first metric you’ll want to look at is your Interaction Rate. By measuring the average number of answers, votes, and comments, per question, you can see how much value your users are getting from the community. A rate above 5 shows that your users are not only engaging with their peers on the platform but also putting in their own time and effort to post content.

Your New Questions and New Answers are two more indicators of engagement and activity within your community. Community size and maturity can have a big impact on these metrics, so it’s more important to look at them over time to ensure neither are dropping too much. It’s also worth looking at these when new groups of users are introduced to the site or after awareness/engagement projects kick off internally. Any spikes in activity can indicate new groups are using Stack Overflow Enterprise and finding value in your community or that your marketing efforts were successful.

The Median Time to Answer is another important metric, as it measures how quickly your users are getting answers to their questions and can be a great indicator for ROI. The shorter the time, the more efficient your users can work and the more money you can save in lost productivity. This should decrease as your community matures and adds in more integrations/webhooks.

Your Answer Ratio will be more important as your community matures and should be used to identify potential knowledge gaps and/or engagement issues. If you see a large amount of unanswered questions in general or for a specific tag, this could indicate the need for more experts/users watching those tags or a need to set up more webhooks and/or integrations. You’ll also want to look at your accepted answers rate, which should be above 40% to ensure users can always find the correct/most helpful answers.

The Daily Unique Visitors metric simply tracks the number of users logging in and viewing  the site once per day. An upward trend or positive spikes would indicate more users are making Stack Overflow Enterprise a part of their daily workflow while a significant drop in visits may be attributed to a slower pace of new posts or users gravitating towards other platforms/old habits.

Votes, Comments, and Edits are also metrics that track engagement, and positive trends in these show that your users are taking ownership of the community and putting in extra time on the site to improve its overall health. Similar to your visits, negative trends here could mean there’s less new content to interact with on the site.

The number of Searches is another great way to measure ROI. More searches on the site show that your users see Stack Overflow Enterprise as the source of truth within your organization. Comparing it to usage across other tools can help you visualize a users workflow as well as potentially identify older tools that are no longer needed.

Your Flags metric might change over time, increasing as new users are introduced to the community and then decreasing as they learn how to properly post on the platform. A consistent upward trend in flags should be investigated by your moderators to see if there are repeat offenders or common mistakes that should be addressed with further guidance from your Community Team.

Lastly, the User Participation metrics can help you identify your top contributors, emerging mentors, and internal experts. You can also look at these when running contests such as Hackathons or Answerathons to choose winners based on participation.

body_markdown:
# Your employer provides several healthcare and counseling benefits through partners, which are highlighted below:

**[WorkLife Matters](http://www.ibhworklife.com/) (via Guardian):** Employees are entitled to unlimited free phone consultations with an EAP counselor, available 24/7, at (800) XXX-XXXX. Our plan will also provide referrals to local counselors (up to 3 sessions free of charge). Visit [www](http://www.ibhworklife.com/) (username = XXX // password = XXX) for more information. This benefit is 100% confidential.

**[Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Alliance](http://www.ptsdalliance.org/):** An alliance of advocacy organizations providing resources to those with PTSD and their loved ones. Employees can also call them at (877) XXX-XXXX.

**[Eden Health](https://www.edenhealth.com/):** Each employee and their adult dependents are eligible to sign up for Eden Health, an app that helps with virtual doctor visits, text help, and insurance navigation. Simply download the Eden Health app and input your work email to register. Once in the app, you’ll be able to update your email address to your personal email address for continued use if you so choose.

**[Bravely](https://workbravely.com/):** Work with a Coach for all aspects of your professional life. Their Pros are here to help employees work through challenges. Employees can take steps forward, and build critical skills, ultimately making their experience at work the best it can be.

**[LifeWorks](https://www.unum.co.uk/employee-assistance-programme) (via Unum):** LifeWorks provides information and confidential practical support on a range of issues including work, family, relationships, money, and health. They also provide a fully-researched referral service that can suggest up to 3 possible providers of childcare or eldercare based on specific requirements.

UK Employees can access the service via:

- [WEBSITE](http://unum-uk.lifeworks.com/): user ID = X and password = X

- 0800 XXX XXXX: confidential support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year

- MOBILE APP: Download the mobile app from the Apple App or Google Play stores; simply search 'Lifeworks' and look for the Lifeworks logo. Or you can download the iPhone app [here](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/lifeworks/id662088737?mt=8), or the Android app [here](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.wam.android). The user ID and password are the same as the ones you use to access the website

**[Crisis Text Line](https://www.crisistextline.org/):** Every UK texter is connected with a Crisis Counselor, a real-life human being trained to bring texters from a hot moment to a cool calm through active listening and collaborative problem-solving.

body_markdown:
Articles is a long-form content solution within Teams. In addition to questions and answers, users will now be able to create an Article to proactively share knowledge with fellow team members. Articles will show up in search results along with Q&A content.

As part of this launch, you will have access to this new feature, as well as a new text editor to make creating content more intuitive than before, in addition to providing contextual feedback to the Article owners and editors.

### Creating Articles

To create an Article, click on the new Articles link in the left nav. Once you’re in the Articles section, click on the Create a new article button. That takes you to the Article creation page.

![](https://s3.amazonaws.com/cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/36071178899/original/CgY6FLo0tc-PcDKcgrtvdfrlC1MOJSOS2A.png?1597065339)

And here’s [how to use Looker](https://stackoverflow.com/c/demo/questions/58), if you were curious.

To start, give your Article an informative title, and pick from one of the four Article types:

- Knowledge Article

- Announcement

- How-To Guide

- Policy

Article types give your Team members a general idea of the type of content within the Article.

Next, pick at least one tag to classify your Article. You can add up to 5 tags.

Once you’ve added your tag(s), it’s time to write the Article. As part of this launch, we’re rolling out an improved text editor that supports seamlessly switching between a robust WYSIWYG format, and using Markdown. To save time, try copy-pasting existing documents you have on other platforms, right into the editor.

Upload images, use lists, add code snippets, and much more. If you link to questions on your Team within the Article, those questions will also be listed on the sidebar to the right of your Article’s content.

When you’re done, click Save, and your Article will be published.

### Give feedback on Articles

Once your Article is published, Team members can provide feedback to the author and editor(s) of the article, as well as highlight its usefulness to the rest of the Team.
title: How to use Articles
body:
Articles is a long-form content solution within Teams. In addition to questions and answers, users will now be able to create an Article to proactively share knowledge with fellow team members. Articles will show up in search results along with Q&A content.

As part of this launch, you will have access to this new feature, as well as a new text editor to make creating content more intuitive than before, in addition to providing contextual feedback to the Article owners and editors.

Creating Articles

To create an Article, click on the new Articles link in the left nav. Once you’re in the Articles section, click on the Create a new article button. That takes you to the Article creation page.

And here’s how to use Looker, if you were curious.

To start, give your Article an informative title, and pick from one of the four Article types:

  • Knowledge Article

  • Announcement

  • How-To Guide

  • Policy

Article types give your Team members a general idea of the type of content within the Article.

Next, pick at least one tag to classify your Article. You can add up to 5 tags.

Once you’ve added your tag(s), it’s time to write the Article. As part of this launch, we’re rolling out an improved text editor that supports seamlessly switching between a robust WYSIWYG format, and using Markdown. To save time, try copy-pasting existing documents you have on other platforms, right into the editor.

Upload images, use lists, add code snippets, and much more. If you link to questions on your Team within the Article, those questions will also be listed on the sidebar to the right of your Article’s content.

When you’re done, click Save, and your Article will be published.

Give feedback on Articles

Once your Article is published, Team members can provide feedback to the author and editor(s) of the article, as well as highlight its usefulness to the rest of the Team.

Entering a timecard is quick and easy.

**Step 1:** From the portal, click the "+" next to TIMECARDS, under Payroll on the left navigation menu.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6096983700originalZMRT_OlLEHW39meK8E3DvqzMUAu5vAKkig.png)

**Step 2:** Choose your week ending date, your position, and Click CREATE. *NOTE: Your Primary Position is the position you are filling out the timecard for.  Don't see your position? Continue filling out the timecard and add a Note on the next page in the Notes section.*

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6096984056original83nwjjJhRuskZS0jVU0hEG7UZ4p-HPOn2A.png)If this timecard will have the same hours as a previous week, click COPY FROM in the upper right then select the timecard to copy.  You will be able to select from the 4 most recent timecards processed.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6073315818originalE_AfjipdZ-ak5_MNcHxKdU4fyE42cDCyEQ.png)

**Step 3:** Choose the Work Location from the drop down menu or select OTHER LOCATION if it is not available.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6097014095original4DPLPGqpORv3ITRkjFhikgxfYDB54OI6_Q.png)

If you worked at multiple locations in one week, select each location from the Work Location column for each day.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6076193705original2PTpOPaA8dGuTandlHrHtv-6Ay9HlPuMkw.png)

**Step 4:** Check the Lunch and/or Dinner box if applicable for days during this week.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6097014369originalxrAUo7vjZMp__Be0cIy6ZuCiiy5qoeDmaw.png)  
**Step 5:** Fill out the timecard hours accordingly. *NOTE: Actions can be used to copy from one day then paste to another.  Split can be used to divide a day if for example, two different positions were worked on the same day or half a day was a prep day. NOTE: Daily and Weekly rate employees will not enter in and wrap times. Only total hours worked.*

*![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6073304912originalYc2tvJDZWTQTL5eZooYbdGvPDrG-MYcfKQ.png)*  
 \*\*  
Step 6:\*\* In the Other Earnings section, click ADD ITEM.  Select the Type and enter the Amount (number of days), the Unit, Rate and Description.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6073305443originalSllDsi_xIPM0-BQFNjIU7RakvYhQ45kKrw.png)

**Step 7:** Use the Notes section to make any notes for your employer and click SUBMIT NOTE. **For example:***"My position wasn't listed."*

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6073305494originalw9HFLlr0X3wVg7T0Pvr9esMLV0Np3qZQFg.png)

If you would like to add an attachment to the timecard, click UPLOAD in the Files section or drag and drop a file.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6073310340originaloCA2d1qjn1keUB--ZtJbCsRnvZVbBKQQug.png)

**Step 8:** Verify your Total Hours are correct.

![](https://support.gslate.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/s3.amazonaws.comcdn.freshdesk.comdatahelpdeskattachmentsproduction6097079015original1GGh5_aIJICq5AeR_hmzDnMX1EvUXY4-5Q.png)

**Step 9:** Click SUBMIT.

**Step 10:** Upon submitting your timecard, a window will open in which you can sign by holding the left mouse button if you are on a desktop computer or with your finger if you are using a mobile device.  Once you sign your timecard, it will become read-only for your employer.  If your employer notices any changes that need to be made, he/she will reject the timecard back to you with notes.

If you've made a mistake on your timecard, you can access your timecard again by clicking VIEW from the Timecards page and then click EDIT to make changes. This option is only available if your timecard has not yet been approved by your employer.

For [assistance](https://soedemo.stackenterprise.co/questions/16862/16863#16863) with payroll.
title: How to Enter a Timecard
body:
Entering a timecard is quick and easy.

Step 1: From the portal, click the "+" next to TIMECARDS, under Payroll on the left navigation menu.

Step 2: Choose your week ending date, your position, and Click CREATE. NOTE: Your Primary Position is the position you are filling out the timecard for.  Don't see your position? Continue filling out the timecard and add a Note on the next page in the Notes section.

If this timecard will have the same hours as a previous week, click COPY FROM in the upper right then select the timecard to copy.  You will be able to select from the 4 most recent timecards processed.

Step 3: Choose the Work Location from the drop down menu or select OTHER LOCATION if it is not available.

If you worked at multiple locations in one week, select each location from the Work Location column for each day.

Step 4: Check the Lunch and/or Dinner box if applicable for days during this week.


Step 5: Fill out the timecard hours accordingly. NOTE: Actions can be used to copy from one day then paste to another.  Split can be used to divide a day if for example, two different positions were worked on the same day or half a day was a prep day. NOTE: Daily and Weekly rate employees will not enter in and wrap times. Only total hours worked.


 **
Step 6:** In the Other Earnings section, click ADD ITEM.  Select the Type and enter the Amount (number of days), the Unit, Rate and Description.

Step 7: Use the Notes section to make any notes for your employer and click SUBMIT NOTE. For example:"My position wasn't listed."

If you would like to add an attachment to the timecard, click UPLOAD in the Files section or drag and drop a file.

Step 8: Verify your Total Hours are correct.

Step 9: Click SUBMIT.

Step 10: Upon submitting your timecard, a window will open in which you can sign by holding the left mouse button if you are on a desktop computer or with your finger if you are using a mobile device.  Once you sign your timecard, it will become read-only for your employer.  If your employer notices any changes that need to be made, he/she will reject the timecard back to you with notes.

If you've made a mistake on your timecard, you can access your timecard again by clicking VIEW from the Timecards page and then click EDIT to make changes. This option is only available if your timecard has not yet been approved by your employer.

For assistance with payroll.

body_markdown:
What is the cost of using Kaiser Permanente APIs?  
Access to all Kaiser Permanente APIs is free of charge.  
  
What kinds of data can I get from the APIs? Do you have any example scenarios for Health, Benefits, Facilities, or Provider verification?  
Please see the implementation guide for each API to learn more about the data you can expect to receive. You may also utilize our mock service or request access to a Secure API to gain access to a sandbox environment. Please note that mock services available for all APIs but the sandbox environment is only available for Secure APIs. For more information, please visit [https://www.cms.gov](https://www.cms.gov/)  
  
My data does not represent what is expected; who do I contact?  
Please contact us through our [Contact form](https://developer.kp.org/#/contact) by selecting ‘FHIR API Data Issue’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).  
  
How do I report a bug in the API?  
Please contact us through our [Contact form](https://developer.kp.org/#/contact) by selecting ‘FHIR API Data Issue’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).  
  
What are the parameters on each specific API?  
Please visit each individual API’s details page to obtain its implementation guide and utilize its mock services for this information.  
  
When I input data and time, it is giving me unexpected results. Who do I contact?  
Please contact us through our [Contact form](https://developer.kp.org/#/contact) by selecting ‘FHIR API Data Issue’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).  
  
My application experienced a data breach. Who do I contact?  
Please take the following steps:

1. Disable your application's access to the API by renewing your client secret on your application details page.

2. Contact us by calling the Kaiser National Compliance Hotline at 1‐888‐774‐9100.

Can I edit my profile?  
Yes, you are able to update your first and last name in your profile. To protect accounts from being transferred, you will not be able to update your email.  
To delete your account, contact us through our Contact Us form by selecting ‘Account Maintenance’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the email associated with your account and any supporting details.  
  
What do I do when I cannot receive data from the API?  
Please contact us through our [Contact form](https://developer.kp.org/#/contact) by selecting ‘Technical Issues’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).  
  
How do I reset my username and password?  
From the Login screen, select ‘Reset Password’ and follow the provided instructions.  
  
How do I reset my Client ID and Client Secret?  
Your Client ID is unique to each application that you own and cannot be reset. To reset/renew your Client Secret, log into the Developer Portal and navigate to your application’s details page (in the Console). From your application’s details page, you may reset/renew your Client Secret. Please be advised that by taking this action, you will need to update your application to reference your new Client Secret to ensure service is uninterrupted.  
  
Is it possible to deprecate/remove a single API without affecting my access with other Kaiser Permanente APIs?  
Yes, log into the Developer Portal and navigate to your application’s details page. From your list of associated APIs, you may click to deprecate/remove a single API. Please note that if you deprecate/remove a given Secure API from your application, you will not be able to submit a new request to be able to reassociate it with your application.  
  
How do I deprecate/delete my application?  
From the selected application’s details page, locate the button labeled ‘Delete Application’ and confirm your decision. All APIs associated with this application will automatically be removed/deprecated and your Client ID and Secret will be deactivated, making your application no longer available for use. Please note that this does not delete your account from the Developer Portal; you may remain a logged-in user and add a new application at any time.  
  
How do I find out more information about the rejection of my API request?  
Please contact us through our [Contact form](https://developer.kp.org/#/contact) by selecting ‘Registration’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the application’s name, Client ID, and any supporting details you would like us to review.  
  
My account is revoked. How do I appeal this decision?  
Please contact us through our [Contact form](https://developer.kp.org/#/contact) by selecting ‘Registration’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the email associated with your account and any supporting details.  
  
Where can I find Kaiser Permanente’s Meaningful Use APIs?  
Kaiser Permanente Meaningful Use APIs may be found at [https://open.epic.com](https://open.epic.com/).  
  
What is the difference between Open and Secure APIs?  
Open APIs are Kaiser Permanente APIs which can be accessed and implemented without creating an account with the Developer Portal and submitting a request to use. You may begin using Open APIs by following the information provided by its implementation guide, which can be found on the API’s details page.  
  
Secure APIs are Kaiser Permanente APIs which require an account with the Developer Portal and a formal request to be able to implement in your application. Decisions are emailed and updated on your logged-in Console within 5-10 business days of the request date.  
  
Is the Client ID I receive for one application applicable to all my associated APIs?  
Yes, the version of the associated application is tied to its Client ID and Client Secret and can be used for all associated APIs for this application.  
  
Can I start using the API as soon as I sign up? How long does the approval process take?  
Sign up is not required to begin using Open APIs. Secure APIs will require an account and formal request to use. After submitting a request, a decision will be emailed and updated on your logged-in Console within 5-10 business days of the request date.  
  
One of my users is having issues and/or questions with the Kaiser Permanente data source. Where should I direct them?  
Please direct them to [https://kp.org](https://kp.org/)  
  
How do I learn more about Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) and HL7?  
FHIR is a next-generation integration standards framework created by HL7. You can find more information and training on the HL7 webpage located at <https://www.hl7.org/fhir/summary.html>  
  
What do I do if my account and/or email is hacked/compromised?  
Please take the following steps:

1. If you can log into your account, delete ALL of your applications.

2. Contact us through our [Contact form](https://developer.kp.org/#/contact) as soon as possible, selecting ‘Account Maintenance’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the email associated with your account and any supporting details.

What will give me the best viewing experience of the KP Developer Portal?  
The KP Developer Portal provides the best viewing experience at a 1920x1080 resolution (1280x1024 minimum) and on the following browsers:

- Google Chrome

- Microsoft Edge
title: Kaiser API FAQ
body:
What is the cost of using Kaiser Permanente APIs?
Access to all Kaiser Permanente APIs is free of charge.

What kinds of data can I get from the APIs? Do you have any example scenarios for Health, Benefits, Facilities, or Provider verification?
Please see the implementation guide for each API to learn more about the data you can expect to receive. You may also utilize our mock service or request access to a Secure API to gain access to a sandbox environment. Please note that mock services available for all APIs but the sandbox environment is only available for Secure APIs. For more information, please visit https://www.cms.gov

My data does not represent what is expected; who do I contact?
Please contact us through our Contact form by selecting ‘FHIR API Data Issue’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).

How do I report a bug in the API?
Please contact us through our Contact form by selecting ‘FHIR API Data Issue’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).

What are the parameters on each specific API?
Please visit each individual API’s details page to obtain its implementation guide and utilize its mock services for this information.

When I input data and time, it is giving me unexpected results. Who do I contact?
Please contact us through our Contact form by selecting ‘FHIR API Data Issue’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).

My application experienced a data breach. Who do I contact?
Please take the following steps:

  1. Disable your application's access to the API by renewing your client secret on your application details page.

  2. Contact us by calling the Kaiser National Compliance Hotline at 1‐888‐774‐9100.

Can I edit my profile?
Yes, you are able to update your first and last name in your profile. To protect accounts from being transferred, you will not be able to update your email.
To delete your account, contact us through our Contact Us form by selecting ‘Account Maintenance’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the email associated with your account and any supporting details.

What do I do when I cannot receive data from the API?
Please contact us through our Contact form by selecting ‘Technical Issues’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the FHIR ID of your transaction and any supporting details without including any Protected Health Information (PHI) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).

How do I reset my username and password?
From the Login screen, select ‘Reset Password’ and follow the provided instructions.

How do I reset my Client ID and Client Secret?
Your Client ID is unique to each application that you own and cannot be reset. To reset/renew your Client Secret, log into the Developer Portal and navigate to your application’s details page (in the Console). From your application’s details page, you may reset/renew your Client Secret. Please be advised that by taking this action, you will need to update your application to reference your new Client Secret to ensure service is uninterrupted.

Is it possible to deprecate/remove a single API without affecting my access with other Kaiser Permanente APIs?
Yes, log into the Developer Portal and navigate to your application’s details page. From your list of associated APIs, you may click to deprecate/remove a single API. Please note that if you deprecate/remove a given Secure API from your application, you will not be able to submit a new request to be able to reassociate it with your application.

How do I deprecate/delete my application?
From the selected application’s details page, locate the button labeled ‘Delete Application’ and confirm your decision. All APIs associated with this application will automatically be removed/deprecated and your Client ID and Secret will be deactivated, making your application no longer available for use. Please note that this does not delete your account from the Developer Portal; you may remain a logged-in user and add a new application at any time.

How do I find out more information about the rejection of my API request?
Please contact us through our Contact form by selecting ‘Registration’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the application’s name, Client ID, and any supporting details you would like us to review.

My account is revoked. How do I appeal this decision?
Please contact us through our Contact form by selecting ‘Registration’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the email associated with your account and any supporting details.

Where can I find Kaiser Permanente’s Meaningful Use APIs?
Kaiser Permanente Meaningful Use APIs may be found at https://open.epic.com.

What is the difference between Open and Secure APIs?
Open APIs are Kaiser Permanente APIs which can be accessed and implemented without creating an account with the Developer Portal and submitting a request to use. You may begin using Open APIs by following the information provided by its implementation guide, which can be found on the API’s details page.

Secure APIs are Kaiser Permanente APIs which require an account with the Developer Portal and a formal request to be able to implement in your application. Decisions are emailed and updated on your logged-in Console within 5-10 business days of the request date.

Is the Client ID I receive for one application applicable to all my associated APIs?
Yes, the version of the associated application is tied to its Client ID and Client Secret and can be used for all associated APIs for this application.

Can I start using the API as soon as I sign up? How long does the approval process take?
Sign up is not required to begin using Open APIs. Secure APIs will require an account and formal request to use. After submitting a request, a decision will be emailed and updated on your logged-in Console within 5-10 business days of the request date.

One of my users is having issues and/or questions with the Kaiser Permanente data source. Where should I direct them?
Please direct them to https://kp.org

How do I learn more about Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) and HL7?
FHIR is a next-generation integration standards framework created by HL7. You can find more information and training on the HL7 webpage located at https://www.hl7.org/fhir/summary.html

What do I do if my account and/or email is hacked/compromised?
Please take the following steps:

  1. If you can log into your account, delete ALL of your applications.

  2. Contact us through our Contact form as soon as possible, selecting ‘Account Maintenance’ from the Category dropdown. In your message, include the email associated with your account and any supporting details.

What will give me the best viewing experience of the KP Developer Portal?
The KP Developer Portal provides the best viewing experience at a 1920x1080 resolution (1280x1024 minimum) and on the following browsers:

  • Google Chrome

  • Microsoft Edge

body_markdown:
Stack Overflow Enterprise can be installed either on your premises, or hosted by us on Azure Cloud.

# Architecture

Stack Overflow Enterprise consists of the following components. Note that in cloud-hosted scenario, we provide all but the blue components. In an On-Premise environment, you will need to provide hardware (or virtual machines) and licenses for all components.

* One or more hosts running Stack Overflow Enterprise, running on top of ASP.net and IIS on Windows Server

* One or more hosts running Redis - <https://redis.io/> - as a cache and pub/sub system (can be the same as the host running Stack Overflow Enterprise)

* One or more hosts running Elasticsearch - <https://www.elastic.co/> - for search functionality(can be the same as the host running Stack Overflow Enterprise)

* Two SQL Server databases, running on a server or cluster provided by you (for On-Premise deployments) or us (for Cloud deployments)

* An Authentication Provider/Directory Service (provided by you) for users to authenticate against

* A place to store uploaded Images. This can be a network share that the Web Servers can read from/write to.

* An SMTP Server for Stack Overflow Enterprise to send emails through

Diagram:

![](https://s3.amazonaws.com/cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/22026803430/original/_O1E_ej_Y0ej2Ues8fjCDbIMLDMFtv3OTQ.png?1538671647)

# System Requirements

## On-Premises Server Requirements

| Hardware Requirements | Exact hardware requirements will vary with the size, scope, and environment of your deployment. The Stack Overflow Engine is highly scalable and can be ramped up on hardware as needed - for instance, the public StackOverflow.com site is one of the top 60 most visited sites in the world, and it can run (if necessary) on one very strong physical server.You can see the detailed architecture of the public family of StackExchange sites via the following blog post: <http://nickcraver.com/blog/2016/02/17/stack-overflow-the-architecture-2016-edition/>. |
| Operating System Server Platform | Microsoft Windows Server 2016 or 2019 with Desktop ExperienceEnglish-language version requiredPlease be aware that Windows Server Core and Nano Server deployments are not supported.Neither are Windows Server versions no longer supported by Microsoft. Please refer to <https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/search/> for support lifecycle information. |
| Operating System Components | Ability to run powershell scripts for installation and upgradesnet Framework 4.6.2 or newerLatest Oracle Java 8 Java SE Runtime Environment (JRE) on Servers hosting Elasticsearch |
| Database Requirements | Microsoft SQL Server 2016 SP1+/2017 Standard or EnterpriseYou need to provide two empty databases - these can be named any way you prefer, however in all documentation we'll refer to them as SitesEE and StackOverflowEECollation should be SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_ASThe User running the setup script will need db_owner permissions to create the necessary objects, and its default schema needs to be set to "dbo" for both databases.The Service Account running the IIS Application Pool for Stack Overflow Enterprise needs db_datareader and db_datawriter permissionSQL Server Authentication is supported, but Windows Authentication is recommended. |
| Hosting Requirements | Stack Overflow Enterprise runs on top of the IIS Web Server and requires HTTPSYou are responsible for providing an HTTPS Certificate for the Hostname(s) that you want to use (e.g., "stackoverflow.example.com") |
| Firewall Requirements | Stack Overflow Enterprise redirects traffic from Port 80 to 443, and requires inbound firewall rules on the server for Port 443 (TCP Protocol) to allow access to the site.(Optional) Allow inbound Port 80 (TCP Protocol) so users accidentally using a http url won't get a connection error.   |
| High Availability / Load Balanced Environments | Stack Overflow Enterprise can support High Availability/Load Balanced Environments. Please contact your sales representative about licensing requirements.Please see the section about support for HA/Load Balanced Environments below. |
| Authentication Requirements | Stack Overflow Enterprise requires users to login and create an account in order to view content and participate on the site. Stack Overflow Enterprise requires an existing directory service that handles authentication.We support these protocols:SAML 2.0, either IDP or SP initiatedActive DirectoryPlease see the section about setting up Authentication below. |
| Other Requirements | The application requires the details of an SMTP Server that the application can send email through. We support SSL and authentication.The application supports uploading of images (e.g., Profile Pictures or images in Questions/Answers). There are several storage options:A file system, either local or on a network share. In a load-balanced environment, you need to make sure it is stored on a location that all servers can reach.Azure Cloud Blob Storage if you have your own Azure Storage ServiceStoring Images in SQL Server directly. Images will be stored in the StackOverflowEE database, in a table called "Images" |

## Cloud-Hosted Server Requirements

In a Cloud-Hosted environment, Stack Overflow will provide the databases and server hosting components.

| Hosting Requirements | Stack Overflow Enterprise provides a default URL for your site, but you may choose your own domain name for your site. Stack Overflow Enterprise requires HTTPS.  
  
If you would like to use your own custom URL, you are responsible for providing an HTTPS Certificate for the Hostname(s) that you want to use (e.g., "stackoverflow.example.com"). |
| Authentication Requirements | Stack Overflow Enterprise requires users to login and create an account in order to view content and participate on the site.Stack Overflow Enterprise requires an existing directory service that handles authentication.For Cloud-hosted deployments, we support these protocols:SAML 2.0, either IDP or SP initiatedPlease see the section about setting up Authentication below. |
| Security Requirements | Please contact us about possible security options (e.g., VPN Setup, IP Whitelisting). |

## Client Requirements

| Desktop Browser Support | We support the latest versions of all common browsers:Google ChromeMozilla FirefoxApple Safari (macOS only)Microsoft Edge (Windows 10 only)Opera browser |
| Mobile Browser Support | We support the latest versions of these mobile browsers:Apple Safari (iOS)Google Chrome (Android)Please be aware that in case of SAML 2.0 authentication, you are responsible for making sure the Identity Provider is compatible with the mobile platform. |
| HTTPS Support | If you use an internal CA to create the HTTPS certificate, you are responsible for making sure that it is trusted by clients, otherwise you will get security warnings. In our Azure Hosted environment, all connections must be over TLS 1.2 (the latest version of all browsers listed above are compliant) |

# Authentication Setup

## SAML 2.0

Please see here for detailed setup instructions: <https://support.stackenterprise.co/solution/articles/22000215170-saml-authentication-configuration>

Application Requirements for Configuration of SAML 2.0 SSO:

* Assertion Consumer Service URL, e.g. https://*stackoverflow.your-org.com*/auth/saml2/post

* Public x509 certificate string so we can validate the signature of the SAML Response sent by the Identity Provider

* Issuer ID passed by the Identity Provider in the SAML Response

* Identity Provider URL so that the Stack Overflow Enterprise application knows where to redirect login requests to

* We require the following attributes to be sent by the Identity Provider in the SAML Response:

  * Some unique identifier (e.g. employee id), preferably not the email address

  * Email Address

  * Full Name or Displayed Name

* (Optional) IDP-initiated SAML 2.0

  * Option to disallow SP-initiated SAML 2.0 login, which prevents the app from sending Authentication Requests to your Identity Provider

  * Option to set the IDP-initiated URL from which to login and access the site

* Signed SAML Authentication Requests

  * Option to enable signed SAML AuthN Requests to the Identity Provider

  * Option to upload your own or a self-signed x509 certificate and private key to sign the Authentication Request

* Encrypted XML/Assertion in the SAML Response

  * Option to enable decryption of encrypted XML/Assertion in the SAML Response

  * Option to upload or generate the private key to decrypt the XML/Assertion

## Active Directory (On-Premises only)

* We support basic authentication with Active Directory on a Windows Server 2008 or higher domain controller.

* We do not officially support LDAP or Lightweight Directory Services, but they can work with our AD configuration

# Provided

## On Premises

You provide the following:

* One or more Windows 2016 Servers, along with a Windows and Network Administrator

* Admin access to two empty databases on a SQL 2016 SP1+/2017 Server

* Authentication configuration information

* Details of an SMTP Server that the application can use

We provide a zip file with the application and a set of powershell scripts that handle the following:

* Installation of the server roles and features on the Windows Server

* Installation of the ElasticSearch dependency on the Windows Server

* Installation of the Redis dependency on the Windows Server

* Creation of the two database schemas that the application requires

* Installation or upgrade of the application on the Windows Server

* Configuration of the application in IIS

## Azure Cloud Hosted

You provide the following:

* Provide a Brand Kit so that our design team can apply a customized theme for your site

* Determine the Domain (Host) Name of your site

  * By default, we use our own domain to host your site, but if you would like to use your own domain, you will need to send us an SSL Certificate with Private Key for that domain. We will provide you the server address so you can add a CNAME record to your domain's DNS records.

* SAML 2.0 Configuration Details from your Directory or Identity Services Team

* (Optional) Details of an SMTP Server, or you may use the Sendgrid SMTP Service that we configure by default.

Once we get the brand kit and determine the domain name of your site we do the following:

* Provision the infrastructure for your site in our Azure Subscription and deploy the application.

* Coordinate a meeting with your Directory or Identity Services team to configure and validate the SAML 2.0 Configuration

* Once the first user has logged in, we will hand off to our Customer Success Team for Product Training and Community Building

# Components

The Stack Overflow Enterprise product is comprised of the following components:

* Application / IIS

* SQL

* Redis

* ElasticSearch

* Storage

* Email

Below is a brief description of each component.

## Application / IIS

The application is deployed as a site in Internet Information Services (IIS) on the provisioned Windows Server. The application can only serve the site over HTTPS. Users connect to the site via a javascript-enabled browser. The application is configured to talk to a Redis server, an ElasticSearch server, a SQL Server, and an email server.

## SQL Databases

The application requires the creation of two empty databases with db_owner privileges along with the connection strings to these two databases. The databases should be named a variant of SitesEE and StackOverflowEE. The default schema for the user needs to be set to "dbo" for both databases. These two databases store the data for the site, and the logs and exceptions from the application. We currently require SQL Server 2016 SP1+/2017 Standard Edition or Enterprise Edition or Azure SQL Database Services. The SQL Server may reside on a VM in the Cloud. You may also use AWS RDS SQL Server 2016/2017, but we do not officially provide support for it.

## Redis

Redis is used by the application to cache values in order to minimize queries and expensive computations performed in the SQL databases. Redis is also used as a publish and subscribe mechanism where one Redis server can publish a message and all other subscribers receive it - including downstream clients on Redis slaves. We currently ship version 2.8.2402 for Windows. For Load Balanced setups, we support running Redis in a master-slave configuration on CentOS 7 servers.

## Elasticsearch

Elasticsearch is used by the application to index data in order to perform searches on the site, calculate related questions, and provide suggestions when asking a question. Up to version 2.0.3826, we ship Elasticsearch 1.7.1 for Windows. Starting version 2018.1.x, we ship Elasticsearch 5.6 for Windows. For Load Balanced setups, we support running Elasticsearch in a 3-node cluster on a set of CentOS 7 servers.

## Storage

The application supports image uploads for question/answer posts and user profile images. For a single-node setup, you may use a folder on the local web server. We also support Azure Storage Service via the use of an access key. For a load balanced setup, you will need to use a UNC path to a network share, or a locally mounted network drive on each web server.

## Email

The application can send notification and subscription emails if you provide the details of an SMTP Server. The application supports SSL and authentication.

# Load Balanced and High Availability Setups

## Azure Hosted

The Azure Hosted service is configured by default, in one region, load balanced over two web servers. You may upgrade to a multi-region HA setup, along with additional web servers for an additional cost.

## On Premises

We do not provide support for a load balanced setup for installs with less than 1000 users. Instead, the application, Redis, and Elasticsearch are installed on a single Windows Server.

We provide support for a load balanced (HA) setup for installs with at least 1000 users. This includes:

* Support for multiple web servers running IIS

* Support for a 2 or 3-node Elasticsearch cluster running on Windows 2016 or CentOS 7

* Support for 2 Redis servers running Windows 2016 or CentOS 7 in a master-slave configuration

* You may use SQL Server Availability Groups, but we do not provide technical support for this feature.

Authentication Setup

SAML 2.0

Please see here for detailed setup instructions: https://support.stackenterprise.co/solution/articles/22000215170-saml-authentication-configuration

Application Requirements for Configuration of SAML 2.0 SSO:

  • Assertion Consumer Service URL, e.g. https://stackoverflow.your-org.com/auth/saml2/post

  • Public x509 certificate string so we can validate the signature of the SAML Response sent by the Identity Provider

  • Issuer ID passed by the Identity Provider in the SAML Response

  • Identity Provider URL so that the Stack Overflow Enterprise application knows where to redirect login requests to

  • We require the following attributes to be sent by the Identity Provider in the SAML Response:

    • Some unique identifier (e.g. employee id), preferably not the email address

    • Email Address

    • Full Name or Displayed Name

  • (Optional) IDP-initiated SAML 2.0

    • Option to disallow SP-initiated SAML 2.0 login, which prevents the app from sending Authentication Requests to your Identity Provider

    • Option to set the IDP-initiated URL from which to login and access the site

  • Signed SAML Authentication Requests

    • Option to enable signed SAML AuthN Requests to the Identity Provider

    • Option to upload your own or a self-signed x509 certificate and private key to sign the Authentication Request

  • Encrypted XML/Assertion in the SAML Response

    • Option to enable decryption of encrypted XML/Assertion in the SAML Response

    • Option to upload or generate the private key to decrypt the XML/Assertion

Active Directory (On-Premises only)

  • We support basic authentication with Active Directory on a Windows Server 2008 or higher domain controller.

  • We do not officially support LDAP or Lightweight Directory Services, but they can work with our AD configuration

Provided

On Premises

You provide the following:

  • One or more Windows 2016 Servers, along with a Windows and Network Administrator

  • Admin access to two empty databases on a SQL 2016 SP1+/2017 Server

  • Authentication configuration information

  • Details of an SMTP Server that the application can use

We provide a zip file with the application and a set of powershell scripts that handle the following:

  • Installation of the server roles and features on the Windows Server

  • Installation of the ElasticSearch dependency on the Windows Server

  • Installation of the Redis dependency on the Windows Server

  • Creation of the two database schemas that the application requires

  • Installation or upgrade of the application on the Windows Server

  • Configuration of the application in IIS

Azure Cloud Hosted

You provide the following:

  • Provide a Brand Kit so that our design team can apply a customized theme for your site

  • Determine the Domain (Host) Name of your site

    • By default, we use our own domain to host your site, but if you would like to use your own domain, you will need to send us an SSL Certificate with Private Key for that domain. We will provide you the server address so you can add a CNAME record to your domain's DNS records.

  • SAML 2.0 Configuration Details from your Directory or Identity Services Team

  • (Optional) Details of an SMTP Server, or you may use the Sendgrid SMTP Service that we configure by default.

Once we get the brand kit and determine the domain name of your site we do the following:

  • Provision the infrastructure for your site in our Azure Subscription and deploy the application.

  • Coordinate a meeting with your Directory or Identity Services team to configure and validate the SAML 2.0 Configuration

  • Once the first user has logged in, we will hand off to our Customer Success Team for Product Training and Community Building

Components

The Stack Overflow Enterprise product is comprised of the following components:

  • Application / IIS

  • SQL

  • Redis

  • ElasticSearch

  • Storage

  • Email

Below is a brief description of each component.

Application / IIS

The application is deployed as a site in Internet Information Services (IIS) on the provisioned Windows Server. The application can only serve the site over HTTPS. Users connect to the site via a javascript-enabled browser. The application is configured to talk to a Redis server, an ElasticSearch server, a SQL Server, and an email server.

SQL Databases

The application requires the creation of two empty databases with db_owner privileges along with the connection strings to these two databases. The databases should be named a variant of SitesEE and StackOverflowEE. The default schema for the user needs to be set to "dbo" for both databases. These two databases store the data for the site, and the logs and exceptions from the application. We currently require SQL Server 2016 SP1+/2017 Standard Edition or Enterprise Edition or Azure SQL Database Services. The SQL Server may reside on a VM in the Cloud. You may also use AWS RDS SQL Server 2016/2017, but we do not officially provide support for it.

Redis

Redis is used by the application to cache values in order to minimize queries and expensive computations performed in the SQL databases. Redis is also used as a publish and subscribe mechanism where one Redis server can publish a message and all other subscribers receive it - including downstream clients on Redis slaves. We currently ship version 2.8.2402 for Windows. For Load Balanced setups, we support running Redis in a master-slave configuration on CentOS 7 servers.

Elasticsearch

Elasticsearch is used by the application to index data in order to perform searches on the site, calculate related questions, and provide suggestions when asking a question. Up to version 2.0.3826, we ship Elasticsearch 1.7.1 for Windows. Starting version 2018.1.x, we ship Elasticsearch 5.6 for Windows. For Load Balanced setups, we support running Elasticsearch in a 3-node cluster on a set of CentOS 7 servers.

Storage

The application supports image uploads for question/answer posts and user profile images. For a single-node setup, you may use a folder on the local web server. We also support Azure Storage Service via the use of an access key. For a load balanced setup, you will need to use a UNC path to a network share, or a locally mounted network drive on each web server.

Email

The application can send notification and subscription emails if you provide the details of an SMTP Server. The application supports SSL and authentication.

Load Balanced and High Availability Setups

Azure Hosted

The Azure Hosted service is configured by default, in one region, load balanced over two web servers. You may upgrade to a multi-region HA setup, along with additional web servers for an additional cost.

On Premises

We do not provide support for a load balanced setup for installs with less than 1000 users. Instead, the application, Redis, and Elasticsearch are installed on a single Windows Server.

We provide support for a load balanced (HA) setup for installs with at least 1000 users. This includes:

  • Support for multiple web servers running IIS

  • Support for a 2 or 3-node Elasticsearch cluster running on Windows 2016 or CentOS 7

  • Support for 2 Redis servers running Windows 2016 or CentOS 7 in a master-slave configuration

  • You may use SQL Server Availability Groups, but we do not provide technical support for this feature.

# 25 Earth Day Facts—Plus, How to Help the Planet Even While 'Social Distancing'

![](https://static.parade.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/earth-day-facts.jpg)To learn about how to celebrate, click [here.](https://soedemo.stackenterprise.co/questions/16689)

## 25 facts about Earth Day

**1.** Gaylord Nelson, a senator from Wisconsin, [founded Earth Day](https://www.earthday.org/history/) in 1970 to raise public consciousness about environmental concerns such as pollution, oil spills and vanishing wildlife. He tapped into the energy of the anti-war movement, framing Earth Day as a “national teach-in on the environment.”

**2.** April 22 was [chosen](https://www.earthday.org/history/) as the date for Earth Day because it fell between Spring Break and final exams, and organizers wanted to maximize student involvement.

**3.** Twenty million Americans, or about 10 percent of the country’s population at the time, [took part](https://www.earthday.org/history/) in events and demonstrations on the first Earth Day.

**Related: [Things to Do With Kids](https://parade.com/1009774/stephanieosmanski/things-to-do-with-kids-during-coronavirus-quarantine/)**

**4.** The first Earth Day pushed environmental concerns onto the national agenda. That same year, Congress [authorized](https://www.earthday.org/history/) the creation of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.

**5.** The first Earth Day in 1970 [inspired](https://www.earthday.org/history/) the passage of the Clean Air, Clean Water and Endangered Species Acts, according to the EPA.

**6.** The theme for [Earth Day 2020](https://www.earthday.org/earth-day-2020/?gclid=Cj0KCQjwjcfzBRCHARIsAO-1_OqTb7OFeH6GAifMYmJXAZhHHUB86ALd5JSVeJty0G_cFCHepvgAH2QaAoHQEALw_wcB) is Climate Action.

**7.** Around 1 billion people [take part](https://www.earthday.org/about-us/) in Earth Day activities around the world every year.

**8.** In the lead-up to Earth Day this year, millions of people worldwide will participate in [Earth Hour](http://worldwidelife.org/earthhour) on March 28. At 8:30 p.m. local time, people will participate in events and demonstrate their commitment to the planet. In past years, Earth Hour gatherings have contributed to real policy changes, including the creation of a marine-protected area in Argentina and environmental protection legislation in Russia.

WWF’s Earth Hour is the world’s largest grassroots movement for the planet that gives us an opportunity to demonstrate our commitment to the planet. In light of the [coronavirus](https://parade.com/987803/lisamulcahy/coronavirus/) crisis, Earth Hour will be [celebrated digitally](https://www.earthhour.org/) this year.

**9.** On Earth Day in 2011, people [planted 28 million trees](https://www.thoughtco.com/must-know-facts-about-earth-day-4021763) in Afghanistan as part of a “Plant Trees Not Bombs” campaign.

**10.** Since the first Earth Day, average annual temperatures in the contiguous United States [have been warming](https://www.climatecentral.org/news/us-warming-trend-earth-day-20257) at a rate of 0.45°F per decade.

**11.** Humans today use about 50 percent more natural resources than we did 30 years ago, according to a report from [Friends of the Earth](https://cdn.friendsoftheearth.uk/sites/default/files/downloads/overconsumption.pdf).

**12.** Animal species populations saw an overall decline of 60 percent worldwide between 1970 and 2014, due to habitat loss, pollution, climate change and other factors, according to the [WWF](https://c402277.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/publications/1187/files/original/LPR2018_Full_Report_Spreads.pdf).

**13.** 2019 was the second-hottest year on record worldwide, just behind 2016, according to the [National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration](https://www.noaa.gov/news/2019-was-2nd-hottest-year-on-record-for-earth-say-noaa-nasa).

**14.** Twenty of the warmest years on record worldwide have occurred in the past 22 years, according to [Climate Central](https://www.climatecentral.org/gallery/graphics/the-10-hottest-global-years-on-record).

**15.** Scientists estimate that dozens of plants and animal species [go extinct each day](https://www.earthday.org/5-terrifying-climate-change-facts-scare-halloween/) due to human activity.

**16.** Rising global temperatures are leading to more extreme weather events, including more intense wildfires and more frequent, high-intensity hurricanes, according to the [Earth Day Network](https://www.earthday.org/5-terrifying-climate-change-facts-scare-halloween/).

**17.** The world’s population is expected to increase from 7 billion today to 9 billion in 2020, which will only increase the impact of human activity on the environment, according to the [Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development](https://www.oecd.org/env/indicators-modelling-outlooks/oecdenvironmentaloutlookto2050theconsequencesofinaction-keyfactsandfigures.htm).

**18.** Today’s average American generates about 4.5 pounds of trash per day, compared to 2.68 pounds in 1960, according to the [EPA](https://www.epa.gov/facts-and-figures-about-materials-waste-and-recycling/national-overview-facts-and-figures-materials#NationalPicture).

**19.** Food accounts for 10 to 30 percent of a household’s carbon footprint, due to the emissions involved in food production and transportation, according to the [Center for Sustainable Systems](http://css.umich.edu/factsheets/carbon-footprint-factsheet).

**20.** U.S. automobile fuel economy [increased 24 percent](http://css.umich.edu/factsheets/carbon-footprint-factsheet) between 2004 and 2017.

**21.** You can [improve your car’s fuel economy](http://css.umich.edu/factsheets/carbon-footprint-factsheet) by 7 to 14 percent simply by obeying the speed limit.

**22.** Electronic devices plugged in on “standby” mode [can account for 5 to 10 percent](http://css.umich.edu/factsheets/carbon-footprint-factsheet) of a household’s energy use.

**23.** Using a dishwasher is more eco-friendly than hand-washing dishes, according to a recent [study](https://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/bitstream/handle/2027.42/148829/Porras_Gabriela_Thesis_Life%20Cycle%20of%20Manual%20and%20Machine%20Dishwashing%20in%20Households%20.pdf?sequence=1) from the University of Michigan.

**24.** Nearly 80 percent of all plastic waste ever created by humans is still in the environment, according to [Recycle Now](https://www.recyclenow.com/plastic-planet?gclid=Cj0KCQjw6sHzBRCbARIsAF8FMpXfV4nQZMLIv8RdLbIzxSVaDoSExphLESgQ3bJfsdVB7cR7pQj7VfIaAggmEALw_wcB).

**25.** More than 30 countries and regions have introduced bans on disposable plastic bags to fight plastic waste, according to [Greenpeace](https://www.greenpeace.org/usa/key-facts-about-plastic-pollution/).
title: Earth Day !
